entry.title: Weekly development meetings on IRC
entry.summary: The conversation is about using a timezone that does not use DST, as the current timezone (PDT) changes time twice a year and affects meeting times. Luke Dashjr suggested quoting an actual timezone of a specific area to avoid this inconvenience. The idea of using tonal time was also mentioned. The sender of the email offered their tech services for free and provided links to their projects, including Litmocracy, Meme Racing, and webmastering The Voluntaryist, which now accepts Bitcoin. The email ended with a quote from Satoshi Nakamoto, suggesting it is more profitable to play by the rules.
